install.description: Tamka Router that implements Pretty Permanent URLs

param.default: Tamka URL Option: Tamka creates one, and only one, URL for each detail item, such as an Article, Contact, News Feed, Poll, or Web Link. Here, you can configure the pattern used for those URLs.

param.name: option
param.label: Tamka URL Option
param.description: Select the Tamka URL Option preferred or choose Custom URL and define a pattern, below.

param.default: Custom URL: If Custom URL was selected above, specify the combination of section, category, ccyy, mm, dd values desired, ending with the literal 'detail', for a Custom URL. Note: separate each option with a forward slash.

param.name: customurl
param.label: Custom URL Pattern
param.description: If Custom URL was selected above, enter the Custom URL pattern, separated by forward slashes, using the preferred combination of year, month, day, section, category values desired, ending with the literal 'detail'.

param.default: Alias or ID: For each portion of the URL, Tamka can use with the alias value (ex. my-article-alias), or the numeric key value (ex. 123). Selecting 'ID' with 'Use Detail Alias, not ID' instructs Tamka to use the numeric values for all levels of the URL except the Detail level. (ex. 123/my-article-alias.)

param.name: idoralias
param.label: Alias or ID
param.description: Use the URL Alias Value or the numeric key for section, category, and article components within the URL.

param.name: detailalias
param.label: Use Article Alias, not ID
param.description: If ID was selected for the previous option, and 'Yes' is selected for this option, Tamka will use the Alias for the Detail level of the URL and the Numeric IDs for the upper levels of the URL. An example for a category/article URL would look like http://example.com/123/article-alias

param.default: File extension: Configure Tamka URLs to not use any file extension, or to use an extension of your preference. (ex. html)

param.name: extension
param.label: Extension
param.description: Select the file extension desired, if any.

param.default: Default Menu Item: For Blogs and Groups that do not have a matching Menu Item.

param.name: defaultmenuitemblog
param.label: Blog Menu Item
param.description: Default Menu item for Blog Posts without a matching Menu Item, given the URL.

param.name: defaultmenuitemgroup
param.label: Group Menu Item
param.description: Default Menu item for Group Discussions without a matching Menu Item, given the URL.

param.default: Base: Use the specified value for the base of Tag and Tag Menu Summary pages.

param.name: tagbase
param.label: Tag Base
param.description: Specify the value to use in the base URL to indicate a tag has been clicked. If you specify the value tag, the URL would be http://example.com/tag/tag-value.

param.name: tagmenubase
param.label: Tag Menu Base
param.description: Specify the value to use in the base URL to indicate a Tag Menu has been clicked. If you specify the value menu, the URL would be http://example.com/menu/tag-value.

param.name: page
param.label: Pagination
param.description: Specify the value to use in the base URL to indicate a pagination link has been clicked. If you specify the value page, the URL would be http://example.com/page/3.

param.name: datebase
param.label: Date Base
param.description: Specify the value to use in the base URL to indicate a Blog Calendar link has been clicked. If you specify the value tag, the URL would be http://example.com/date/ccyy/mm.

param.default: No WWW: Configure Tamka to remove WWW from incoming URLs, and 301 redirect to the same location without the WWW.

param.name: noWWW
param.label: No WWW
param.description: Electing this option will remove WWW from incoming URLs and 301 redirect to the same location, without that value.

param.default: Note: Tamka URLs work in conjunction with Joomla! URL options.
